001/*

006
007package renderer.models_LP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a wireframe model of a sector of a ring (an annulus)
015   in the xy-plane centered at the origin.
016<p>
017   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annulus_(mathematics)" target="_top">
018                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annulus_(mathematics)</a>
019<p>
020   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circular_sector" target="_top">
021                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circular_sector</a>
022
023   @see Ring
024*/
025public class RingSector extends Model implements MeshMaker
026{
027   public final double r1;
028   public final double r2;
029   public final double theta1;
030   public final double theta2;
031   public final int n;
032   public final int k;
033
034   /**
035      Create half a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane
036      with outer radius 1, inner radius 0.33, with 7
037      spokes coming out of the center, and with 5
038      concentric circles.
039   */
040   public RingSector( )
041   {
042      this(1.0, 0.33, 0, Math.PI, 5, 7);
043   }
044
045
046   /**
047      Create a sector of a ring (annulus) in the xy-plane
048      with outer radius {@code r1}, inner radius {@code r2},
049      with {@code k} spokes coming out of the center, and
050      with {@code n} concentric circles.
051   <p>
052      If there are {@code k} spokes, then each (partial) circle
053      around the center will have {@code k-1} line segments.
054      If there are {@code n} concentric circles around the center,
055      then each spoke will have {@code n-1} line segments.
056   <p>
057      There must be at least four spokes and at least two concentric circle.
058
059      @param r1      outer radius of the ring
060      @param r2      inner radius of the ring
061      @param theta1  beginning angle of the sector (in radians)
062      @param theta2  ending angle of the sector (in radians)
063      @param n       number of concentric circles
064      @param k       number of spokes in the ring
065      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
066      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
067   */
068   public RingSector(final double r1, final double r2,
069                     double theta1, double theta2,
070                     final int n, final int k)
071   {
072      super(String.format("Ring Sector(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
073                                       r1, r2, theta1, theta2, n, k));
074
075      if (n < 2)
076         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
077      if (k < 4)
078         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 3");
079
080      theta1 = theta1 % (2*Math.PI);
081      theta2 = theta2 % (2*Math.PI);
082      if (theta1 < 0) theta1 = 2*Math.PI + theta1;
083      if (theta2 < 0) theta2 = 2*Math.PI + theta2;
084      if (theta2 <= theta1) theta2 = theta2 + 2*Math.PI;
085
086      this.r1 = r1;
087      this.r2 = r2;
088      this.theta1 = theta1;
089      this.theta2 = theta2;
090      this.n = n;
091      this.k = k;
092
093      // Create the rings's geometry.
094
095      final double deltaR = (r1 - r2) / (n - 1),
096                   deltaTheta = (theta2 - theta1) / (k - 1);
097
098      // An array of vertices to be used to create line segments.
099      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
100
101      // Create all the vertices.
102      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a spoke (an angle)
103      {
104         final double c = Math.cos(theta1 + j * deltaTheta),
105                      s = Math.sin(theta1 + j * deltaTheta);
106         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // move along the spoke
107         {
108            final double ri = r2 + i * deltaR;
109            v[i][j] = new Vertex(ri * c,
110                                 ri * s,
111                                 0);
112         }
113      }
114
115      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
116      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
117      {
118         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
119         {
120            addVertex( v[i][j] );
121         }
122      }
123
124      // Create a line strip for each concentric ring.
125      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)  // choose a ring
126      {
127         final LineStrip lineStrip = new LineStrip();
128         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
129         {
130            lineStrip.addIndex( (i * k) + j );  // v[i][j]
131         }
132         addPrimitive(lineStrip);
133      }
134
135      // Create the spokes connecting the inner circle to the outer circle.
136      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a spoke
137      {
138         final LineStrip lineStrip = new LineStrip();
139         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
140         {
141            lineStrip.addIndex( (i * k) + j);  // v[i][j]
142         }
143         addPrimitive(lineStrip);
144      }
145   }
146
147
148
149   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (thre methods).
150   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
151
152   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
153
154   @Override
155   public RingSector remake(final int n, final int k)
156   {
157      return new RingSector(this.r1, this.r2,
158                            this.theta1, this.theta2,
159                            n, k);
160   }
161}//RingSector
